title: [ETH] Node stucks syncing - err="missing attestation data"
body:
Hi, I have started syncing an ethereum mainnet node.
When I reach the block 16,499,999 it stucks with the following error:
`Could not send beacon block to ETH1 err="missing attestation data"`

I am running erigon  `2.40.1-stable-94b4cee5`  on Windows 10, with this command:
```bash
erigon.exe --config "./config.yaml"
```

With the following config.yaml file:
```yaml
datadir : "D:/erigon_node/data"
chain : "mainnet"
prune.r.before: 10000000 
nat: any
http : true
http.port: 8545
http.addr: 0.0.0.0
http.api : ["eth","debug","net","ots", "trace","web3","erigon"]
http.corsdomain: "*"
torrent.download.rate: "500mb"
```

I just wanted the node to query archive information after block `10M`, thats why I am pruning, and why I am not configuring anything related to the consensus layer or staking.
I thought that it would be because I need to configure a beacon node but, afaik, erigon has a light one by default so I thought I wont need to configure any aditional paramters.

I drop here the logs:
```bash
[WARN] [04-12|19:27:16.085] Could not send beacon block to ETH1      err="missing attestation data"
[INFO] [04-12|19:27:26.025] [8/15 HashState] ETL [1/2] Extracting    current_prefix=98df1b95 alloc=7.1GB sys=17.6GB
[WARN] [04-12|19:27:42.478] Could not send beacon block to ETH1      err="missing attestation data"
[INFO] [04-12|19:27:57.119] [8/15 HashState] ETL [1/2] Extracting    current_prefix=9b964743 alloc=6.5GB sys=17.6GB
[INFO] [04-12|19:28:01.167] [LightClient] P2P                        peers=9
[INFO] [04-12|19:28:01.167] [txpool] stat                            block=0 pending=0 baseFee=0 queued=30000 alloc=6.8GB sys=17.6GB
[INFO] [04-12|19:28:26.025] [8/15 HashState] ETL [1/2] Extracting    current_prefix=9e39c4b6 alloc=4.7GB sys=17.6GB
[INFO] [04-12|19:28:56.025] [8/15 HashState] ETL [1/2] Extracting    current_prefix=a0b86991 alloc=6.3GB sys=17.6GB
[INFO] [04-12|19:28:58.778] [p2p] GoodPeers                          eth67=24 eth66=9 eth68=33
[INFO] [04-12|19:29:01.170] [txpool] stat                            block=0 pending=0 baseFee=0 queued=30000 alloc=6.6GB sys=17.6GB

[INFO] [04-12|19:29:56.026] [8/15 HashState] ETL [1/2] Extracting    current_prefix=a3ee21c3 alloc=6.5GB sys=17.6GB
[INFO] [04-12|19:30:01.174] [txpool] stat                            block=0 pending=0 baseFee=0 queued=30000 alloc=6.9GB sys=17.6GB
[INFO] [04-12|19:30:03.344] [LightClient] P2P                        peers=10

[INFO] [04-12|19:34:01.171] [LightClient] P2P                        peers=8

```
Same here the node stuck at the same block number 16499999

I have updated the binary to the latest version v2.42.0 and now it seems to progress, it has been on the same block for the last 10 hours but  it has moved from stage ` [10/15 CallTraces]`   to  `[11/15 AccountHistoryIndex]`.

I run the same command but get the problems below
```
INFO[04-12|14:38:01.451] [Checkpoint Sync] P2P                    peers=1
INFO[04-12|14:38:03.444] [p2p] GoodPeers
INFO[04-12|14:38:11.451] [Checkpoint Sync] P2P                    peers=3
INFO[04-12|14:38:21.451] [Checkpoint Sync] P2P                    peers=3
INFO[04-12|14:38:31.452] [Checkpoint Sync] P2P                    peers=3
INFO[04-12|14:38:41.451] [Checkpoint Sync] P2P                    peers=4
INFO[04-12|14:38:51.450] [Checkpoint Sync] P2P                    peers=5
INFO[04-12|14:39:01.449] [Checkpoint Sync] P2P                    peers=5
INFO[04-12|14:39:11.449] [Checkpoint Sync] P2P                    peers=6
INFO[04-12|14:39:21.450] [Checkpoint Sync] P2P                    peers=3
```

update: The reason is I didn't run a consensus client (beacon node). I somehow thought erigon came with its own consensus client and it were enabled by default.

---

Same here. I stuck at:
```
May 17 07:30:18 db erigon[1940293]: [INFO] [05-17|07:30:18.627] [txpool] stat                            pending=0 baseFee=0 queued=30000 alloc=3.2GB sys=5.6GB
May 17 07:31:18 db erigon[1940293]: [INFO] [05-17|07:31:18.621] [p2p] GoodPeers                          eth66=43 eth67=25 eth68=70
May 17 07:31:18 db erigon[1940293]: [INFO] [05-17|07:31:18.633] [txpool] stat                            pending=0 baseFee=0 queued=30000 alloc=3.7GB sys=5.6GB
May 17 07:32:18 db erigon[1940293]: [INFO] [05-17|07:32:18.626] [txpool] stat                            pending=0 baseFee=0 queued=30000 alloc=3.0GB sys=5.6GB
May 17 07:33:18 db erigon[1940293]: [INFO] [05-17|07:33:18.621] [p2p] GoodPeers                          eth66=43 eth67=25 eth68=70
May 17 07:33:18 db erigon[1940293]: [INFO] [05-17|07:33:18.635] [txpool] stat                            pending=0 baseFee=0 queued=30000 alloc=3.7GB sys=5.6GB
May 17 07:34:18 db erigon[1940293]: [INFO] [05-17|07:34:18.626] [txpool] stat                            pending=0 baseFee=0 queued=30000 alloc=3.0GB sys=5.6GB
May 17 07:35:18 db erigon[1940293]: [INFO] [05-17|07:35:18.622] [p2p] GoodPeers                          eth66=43 eth67=25 eth68=70
May 17 07:35:18 db erigon[1940293]: [INFO] [05-17|07:35:18.626] [txpool] stat                            pending=0 baseFee=0 queued=30000 alloc=3.6GB sys=5.6GB
May 17 07:36:18 db erigon[1940293]: [INFO] [05-17|07:36:18.626] [txpool] stat                            pending=0 baseFee=0 queued=30000 alloc=3.0GB sys=5.6GB
```
erigon version 2.43.0-stable

I was facing the same issue. Did not know that a Consensus Layer client is needed and the internal consensus layer client (without supoort for staking) is not not enabled by default

I restarted erigon with --internalcl to enable the internal consensus layer client and it is downloading blocks after 16499999 now

The documentation is definately not clear as to how to run an archive node.
This issue is stale because it has been open for 40 days with no activity. Remove stale label or comment, or this will be closed in 7 days.
This issue was closed because it has been stalled for 7 days with no activity.
